column4: Can someone help me - I need to add a line to the GRUB setparams so that ubuntu boots into terminal
gksudo gedit /etc/defaults/grub and run "sudo update-grub" after you make your change
I can't boot - killed xorg - so I need to boot into terminal FROM the grub
e at the grub menu to edit it
so I would change it to setparams "Ubuntu, with Linux 3.0.0-12-generic text"
that's doesn't look right to me... maybe
ok thanks, so just the word text added to the end of that line?
oh no, it still hangs on the ubuntu boot logo :/
take text out and replace it with nomodeset and test
sorry man, nothing's letting me boot
